lowUQScoreModal.text: A Gitcoin Passport score of 15 or over will boost your match funding by 10x. To increase your score, visit the custom GP dashboard below to add more stamps before you allocate.
lowUQScoreModal.checkboxLabel: I understand I will only receive 10% of the max. match funding

success.title: You successfully increased your UQ score
success.message: Full matching leverage is now available to you

multisigSignatureToast.title: Multi-sig: signature needed
multisigSignatureToast.message: At least one signature is required to start allocation. Please do not close Octant.

homeRewards.rewardsRateTooltip: Rewards rate is the percentage of your locked GLM you earn as rewards per epoch

homeGridCurrentGlmLock.tooltipText: Effective lock (EL) is the part of your locked GLM that is currently earning rewards. Lock more & EL increases proportionally to epoch time remaining. Unlock GLM & that amount is removed from EL for the epoch. Note that if EL falls below 100, no rewards will be calculated.

raffleWinnerBadge.tooltipStreamCancelled: Your Sablier stream was canceled due to your inactivity in the last allocation window. If you believe this is a mistake, please open a help ticket on Discord.

homeGridUQScore.scoreTooLow: Score too low? Visit the Octant Passport dashboard
homeGridUQScore.wantToDispute: Want to dispute sybil status? Please use this form

modalCalculatingYourUniqueness.calculatingYourUniquenessStep1:
To prove your uniqueness you need a <0>Gitcoin Passport score of 15 or higher.

If you have this your donations will attract the maximum amount of match funding. If not, maximum match funding will be set to 10%.

You can increase your score in a couple of different ways.
modalCalculatingYourUniqueness.calculatingYourUniquenessStep2:
You can go to our <0>Passport dashboard and add stamps to the score for your Octant address.

If your Passport score is not on your primary address, you can delegate your score from another address with a 15+ Passport score.

You can only do this once, and it must be done before allocating to benefit the current epoch.
modalCalculatingYourUniqueness.calculatingYourUniquenessStep3:
Delegation will not link your addresses or compromise your privacy in any way.

We require proof of uniqueness to defend against sybil attacks as we have switched to a quadratic funding model.

To learn more, check out Gitcoin’s handy <0>guide on improving your score.

modalCalculatingUQScore.delegationFailedText: Delegation failed — your score needs to be 15 or higher. Please try another address

unableToDelegateToAddressWithPositiveGLM.title: Address with GLM locked
unableToDelegateToAddressWithPositiveGLM.message: Please delegate to an address without GLM locked

delegationTooManyUniqueAddresses.title: Too many accounts
delegationTooManyUniqueAddresses.message: Please connect up to 10 accounts to check your delegation status

allocationTooltips.leverageUnknown: We do not know the leverage for this past allocation.
allocationTooltips.finalMatchFunding: Once allocation period has finished we know the exact amount of your matched funding your donation attracted, so we show that rather than just your estimated leverage amount.
allocationTooltips.leverage: Leverage shows the multiple of your donation the projects you chose will receive in matched funding. Note that it may change wildly during an epoch, and be very different to your final matched funding.

patronMode.firstParagraph:
This mode is for token holders
who want to support Octant.
patronMode.secondParagraph: It disables and removes all personal allocations and project donations.
patronMode.thirdParagraph: All rewards go directly to the matching fund with no action required by the patron. Learn more in the <0>Docs</0>.

Slide the switch below all the way to
the right to enable patron mode.
patronMode.fourthParagraphDisable:
Slide the switch below all the way to
the left to disable patron mode.

metrics.epoch1Info: It's Epoch 1, so there are no metrics for the past. It's just a placeholder, please come back in Epoch 2.

modalTimeoutListPresence.header: This account looks like a sybil
modalTimeoutListPresence.text: We have flagged this account as a <0>sybil</0> which means your allocation will receive no match funding this epoch. If you would like to dispute this, please <1>fill out this form</1> & we’ll review it.
modalTimeoutListPresence.checkboxLabel: I understand that I will receive  no match funding this epoch

usingTheApp.text: Before we can go any further, please read the terms of service and click the checkbox below to agree with them.

signingTheTerms.text: At least one signature is required to agree to the Terms of Service. Please do not close Octant until this is completed.

welcomeToOctant.text:
If you locked GLM last epoch, you'll have rewards available during this allocation window, which runs until {{date}}.

If not, lock some GLM in the Home view, and explore the projects for this epoch to get an idea of what Octant is all about.

earnRewards.text:
ETH rewards are earned based on a weighted average, so the more GLM you lock and the longer you lock it for, the more you earn.

You can unlock at any time but doing so will reduce your rewards. Use the calculator in the Home view to estimate potential rewards.

donateToProjects.text:
Check out the lineup for Epoch {{epoch}} in the Projects view. Tap a project tile to read its details and donate to your favourites.

Your donation will be fund matched by Golem Foundation. Just tap the heart to add a project to the Allocate drawer where you can donate.

slideIt.text:
If you have rewards, use the slider in the Allocate drawer to easily divide them between projects or yourself.

To change your choices at any time during allocation, just click Edit, make some changes and reconfirm in your wallet.

welcomeToOctant.text:
Octant is a Golem Foundation experiment in decentralised governance and funding public good projects.

To get started, lock some GLM in the Home view, and explore the projects for this epoch to get an idea of what Octant is all about.

earnRewards.text:
ETH rewards are earned based on a weighted average, so the more GLM you lock and the longer you lock it for, the more you earn.

You can unlock at any time but doing so will reduce your rewards. Use the calculator in the Home view to estimate potential rewards.

getReady.text:
Lock your GLM, check out the projects to support and get ready for the next allocation window which opens on {{date}}.

Visit <0>Octant.build, join the <1>Discord or get project updates on <2>Twitter or <3>Farcaster.

projects.searchInputPlaceholder: Search for projects and epochs eg Tor E1,E2

settings.cryptoMainValueDisplay: Use ETH as main value display
settings.patronModeTooltip: Patron mode is for token holders who want to support Octant. It disables allocation to yourself or projects. All rewards go directly to the matching fund with no action required by the patron.

syncStatus.information:
We're synchronizing things to prepare the
next epoch, so the app will be unavailable
for a little while. Please check back soon.

step1.text: Connect your wallet and click the <1>Lock GLM</1> button. Enter the amount of GLM to lock and confirm the transaction in your wallet.
step1.title: How to lock GLM

step2.text: Keep your GLM locked to earn rewards and use them in the next allocation window. The calendar will show you when that is, just click to open it.
step2.title: Check the calendar

step3.text: When allocation is open, check Projects view and click the heart icons to add them to your cart. Then donate and self-allocate from here.
step3.title: Check your cart

step4.text: You need to verify yourself as unique in order to receive fund matching for your donations. Visit Octant’s Gitcoin passport dashboard to do that.
step4.title: Uniqueness score

step5.text: Estimate the value of your rewards and match funding here. Just enter a GLM amount and the amount of time you plan to lock them for.
step5.title: Estimate your rewards

step6.text: Mouse over the chart to see how projects are doing. Click and drag to see more. Click to open a project's details in a new tab.
step6.title: Results chart

step7.text: During allocation window, click the heart to add projects to your cart. Then open your cart and allocate to your chosen projects and yourself.
step7.title: Add your favourite projects

step8.text: Browse through archived epoch metrics with these navigation arrows
step8.title: Explore previous epochs

step9.text: Hover or tap the donut chart segments to see the details of how funds were used for the epoch
step9.title: Funds usage

step10.text: Drag the slider handle to choose your total donation vs personal amounts. Donations will be split evenly amongst all your chosen projects.
step10.title: Easy mode

step11.text: Edit donation values directly to enter manual mode. Allocate exact amounts to each project, and the remainder will be allocated to you.
step11.title: Manual allocation
